mainCol.title: About
mainCol.text: Diana is a set of algorithms and tools intended for analysis of data independent acquisition mass spectrometry (DIA-MS) data, using a targeted extraction strategy. Taking concepts from our previous work on SRM data analysis, Diana has been shown to be specially suited for analysis and accurate quantification of target peptides in complex backgrounds.

mainCol.title: Source
mainCol.text: DIANA is implemented in scala 2.10 and python 2.7.3 and available as open source (Apache 2.0 license), as well as pre-compiled binaries from http://github.com/flevander/diana. PyProphet is installable through PyPi (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyprophet/0.9.1) or available as open source https://github.com/fickludd/pyprophet.

mainCol.title: Citation
mainCol.text:
DIANA - algorithmic improvements for analysis of complex peptide sample data-independent acquisition MS data
Johan Teleman, Hannes Röst, George Rosenberger, Uwe Schmitt, Lars Malmström, Johan Malmström and Fredrik Levander
Bioinformatics (2014) doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btu686

sideCol.title: Downloads
sideCol.text: The latest binaries are available at <tt>http://github.com/flevander/diana</tt>.

sideCol.title: Source code
sideCol.text: The latest source code and binaries for Diana are available at http://github.com/flevander/diana.
